metadata.title: squid: Denial of Service in SSL Certificate validation (important)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in Squid. Due to an improper validation of the specified index bug, Squid compiled using `--with-openssl` is vulnerable to a denial of service attack against SSL Certificate validation. This flaw allows a remote server to perform a denial of service against the Squid Proxy by initiating a TLS Handshake with a specially crafted SSL Certificate in a server certificate chain. This attack is limited to HTTPS and SSL-Bump. 
            
            MITIGATION: Disable the use of SSL-Bump features:
- Remove all ssl-bump options from http_port and https_port
- Remove all ssl_bump directives from squid.conf

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
squid is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
